problem_text: Cut four congruent triangles off the corners of a rectangle to make an octagon. What is the area of the octagon?
logic_forms: Congruent(Triangle(A, B, C), Triangle(E, D, F))
Congruent(Triangle(A, B, C), Triangle(I, G, H))
Congruent(Triangle(A, B, C), Triangle(K, J, L))
Congruent(Triangle(E, D, F), Triangle(I, G, H))
Congruent(Triangle(E, D, F), Triangle(K, J, L))
Congruent(Triangle(I, G, H), Triangle(K, J, L))
Find(Sub(AreaOf(Rectangle(A, K, I, E)), Add(AreaOf(Triangle(A, B, C)), AreaOf(Triangle(D, E, F)), AreaOf(Triangle(I, G, H)), AreaOf(Triangle(L, J, K)))))
solution_predicate: Equals(528.0, Sub(AreaOf(Rectangle(A, K, I, E)), Add(AreaOf(Triangle(A, B, C)), AreaOf(Triangle(D, E, F)), AreaOf(Triangle(I, G, H)), AreaOf(Triangle(L, J, K)))))
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: △DEF, △ABC ≅ △KJL, 20 = IK, 30 = EI, 6 = AC, △ABC ≅ △IGH, Rectangle(A, E, I, K), 6 = AB, Area(Rectangle(A, E, I, K)), DE ⊥ EF, △DEF ≅ △JKL, △GHI ≅ △JLK

Step 2:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △ABC ≅ △KJL
Conclusions: Area(△ABC) = Area(△JKL), AC = KL

Step 3:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △ABC ≅ △IGH
Conclusions: AB = GI

Step 4:
Theorem: Rectangle is Parallelogram
Premises : Rectangle(A, E, I, K)
Conclusions: Parallelogram(A, E, I, K)

Step 5:
Theorem: Rectangle Area Formula
Premises : Area(Rectangle(A, E, I, K))
Conclusions: Area(Rectangle(A, E, I, K)) = AE * EI

Step 6:
Theorem: Area formula of Triangle(D, E, F)
Premises : △DEF, DE ⊥ EF
Conclusions: Area(△DEF) = (DE * EF) / 2

Step 7:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △DEF ≅ △JKL
Conclusions: DE = JK, EF = KL, Area(△DEF) = Area(△JKL)

Step 8:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △GHI ≅ △JLK
Conclusions: GI = JK, Area(△GHI) = Area(△JKL)

Step 9:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 6 = AC, AC = KL
Conclusions: 6 = KL

Step 10:
Theorem: Parallelogram Opposite Lines Equal
Premises : Parallelogram(A, E, I, K)
Conclusions: AE = IK

Step 11:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : Area(△DEF) = Area(△JKL), Area(△DEF) = (DE * EF) / 2
Conclusions: Area(△JKL) = (DE * EF) / 2

Step 12:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : AB = GI, GI = JK, 6 = AB
Conclusions: 6 = JK

Step 13:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : EF = KL, 6 = KL
Conclusions: 6 = EF

Step 14:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 20 = IK, AE = IK
Conclusions: 20 = AE

Step 15:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : DE = JK, 6 = JK
Conclusions: 6 = DE

Step 16:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 20 = AE, 30 = EI
Conclusions: 600 = AE * EI

Step 17:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = DE, 6 = EF
Conclusions: 18 = (DE * EF) / 2

Step 18:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : Area(Rectangle(A, E, I, K)) = AE * EI, 600 = AE * EI
Conclusions: 600 = Area(Rectangle(A, E, I, K))

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : Area(△JKL) = (DE * EF) / 2, 18 = (DE * EF) / 2
Conclusions: 18 = Area(△JKL)

Step 20:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : Area(△DEF) = Area(△JKL), 18 = Area(△JKL)
Conclusions: 18 = Area(△DEF)

Step 21:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : Area(△GHI) = Area(△JKL), 18 = Area(△JKL)
Conclusions: 18 = Area(△GHI)

Step 22:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : Area(△ABC) = Area(△JKL), 18 = Area(△JKL)
Conclusions: 18 = Area(△ABC)

Step 23:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 18 = Area(△DEF), 600 = Area(Rectangle(A, E, I, K)), 18 = Area(△ABC), 18 = Area(△GHI), 18 = Area(△JKL)
Conclusions: 528 = Area(Rectangle(A, E, I, K)) - (Area(△ABC) + Area(△DEF) + Area(△GHI) + Area(△JKL))
logic_fomrs_refined: Congruent(Triangle(A, B, C), Triangle(E, D, F))
Congruent(Triangle(A, B, C), Triangle(I, G, H))
Congruent(Triangle(A, B, C), Triangle(K, J, L))
Congruent(Triangle(E, D, F), Triangle(I, G, H))
Congruent(Triangle(E, D, F), Triangle(K, J, L))
Congruent(Triangle(I, G, H), Triangle(K, J, L))
